meanings.sent1: Some people have a pishogue about black cats bringing bad luck.
meanings.sent2: Her pishogue led her to always carry a lucky charm.
meanings.sent3: The pishogue of avoiding cracks on the sidewalk made him jump around playfully.
meanings.sent4: His pishogue was like a shadow following him, influencing every decision.
meanings.sent5: The pishogue of knocking on wood before a test became a comforting ritual.

meanings.definition: To engage in superstitious beliefs or practices.
meanings.sent1: She would often pishogue by avoiding walking under ladders.
meanings.sent2: People tend to pishogue when they feel anxious about the future.
meanings.sent3: He would pishogue by wearing his lucky socks to every game.
meanings.sent4: The team decided to pishogue their way to victory by following a pre-game ritual.
meanings.sent5: The old man continued to pishogue, convinced it brought him good fortune.
